bank.question:
What does the following sentence imply?

彼[かれ]は行くと言[い]いました。
options: He is saying he will go.

bank.question:
Who is saying 'their friend is coming' in the sentence below?

リアさんはリリさんが友[とも]達[だち]が来[く]ると言[い]うと言[い]った。
bank.explanation: The sentence can be split like this to be more clear: リアさんは [リリさんが'友[とも]達[だち]が来[く]る'と言う]と言った。This means that the speaker is saying 'Ria said [Lily says 'their friend is coming']'. Thus, Lily is the one saying 'their friend is coming'. /t Note that a better way of phrasing this sentence would be: リアさんは、リリさんが「友[とも]達[だち]が来[く]る」と言[い]ったと話した。This removes some ambiguity.\

bank.question:
Translate the following sentence into Japanese:

She said she will study tomorrow.
bank.sample_answer: 彼[かの]女[じょ]は明日[あした]勉[べん]強[きょう]すると言いました。

bank.question: Translate the following sentence into Japanese: His dad said the bus is more convenient.
bank.sample_answer: 父[とう]さんはバスはもっとべんりだと言いました。

bank.question: Translate to English: アロンくんは魚[さかな]が好きだと言[い]いました。
bank.sample_answer: Aaron said that he likes fish.

bank.question:
What is the name of the taco shop?

あの店[みせ]はタコベルと言[い]うタコス屋[や]です。

Translate the following sentence into Japanese:

That over there is a famous mountain called Mount Fuji.
bank.sample_answer: あれは富[ふ]士[じ]山[さん]と言[い]う有[ゆう]名[めい]な山[やま]です。

bank.question:

bank.question:
Translate the following sentence into Japanese using the と言[い]う grammar pattern:

My dog's name is Pochi.
bank.sample_answer: 私[わたし]の犬[いぬ]はポチと言[い]う名前[なまえ]です。
bank.explanation:
This is a common way to say 'X's name is Y' in Japanese using the と言う grammar pattern. It is a good structure to remember!

This structure can also be used to identify yourself. For example, 私[わたし]はアリスと言[い]います。 ("I am called Alice.").

bank.question:
What does the following sentence imply?

彼[かれ]は明日[あした]来[く]ると思[おも]います。
options: I think he will come tomorrow.
He thinks I will come tomorrow.
He thinks he will come tomorrow.
I think I will come tomorrow.
bank.explanation: The 思[おも]う ending indicates that it is the speaker's thought or opinion.

bank.question:
Translate the following sentence into Japanese:

I think that sushi is delicious.
bank.sample_answer: 寿[す]司[し]は美[お]味[い]しいと思[おも]います。
bank.explanation: The 思[おも]います ending indicates that it is the speaker's thought or opinion.

bank.question:
Translate the following sentence into English:

彼女[かのじょ]は明日[あした]雨[あめ]が降[ふ]ると思[おも]っています。
bank.sample_answer: She thinks that it will rain tomorrow.
bank.explanation: The 思[おも]っています ending indicates that it is her thought or opinion.
